abstract: IntercontinentalExchange’s $8.2 billion takeover of the New York Stock Exchange illustrates starkly how trading in commodities and derivatives has become much more lucrative than trading in the shares of companies.
snippet: IntercontinentalExchange’s $8.2 billion takeover of the New York Stock Exchange illustrates starkly how trading in commodities and derivatives has become much more lucrative than trading in the shares of companies.
lead_paragraph: On a warm day in Boca Raton, Fla., the host of a reception for an annual financial conference was not a big bank or a powerful exchange as in years past, but a young firm based in Atlanta.

headline.main: Exchange Sale Reflects New Realities of Trading
headline.print_headline: Exchange Sale Reflects New Realities of Trading

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Nathaniel Popper
